'''Psychotropic drugs''': all chemical substances of natural or artificial origin which have a '''psychological''' effect, i.e. are capable of modifying mental activity.

'''Main classes''' :

* antipsychotics
* antidepressants
* anxiolytics
* hypnotics
* thymoregulators
* psychostimulants.

question.title: What is the definition of psychotropic drugs?
question.description: Psychotropic drugs are substances that have a psychological effect.

option_a.title: Substances that have a physiological effect on the body
option_a.description: Substances that have a psychological effect on the mind and body

option_b.title: Chemical substances that alter brain chemistry
option_b.description: Substances that affect the mind and body

option_c.title: Only substances that have a psychological effect
option_c.description: Substances that affect the mind and body

option_d.title: Substances that have a therapeutic effect
option_d.description: Substances that have a psychological effect on the mind

correct_option.title: A
correct_option.description: Only substances that have a psychological effect
